name: Foundations in Epidemiology
description: Epidemiology is the study of disease and its determinants in populations. It is grounded in the biomedical paradigm, statistical reasoning, and that risk is context specific. This course will examine such issues as: methods of sampling, types of controls, analysis of data, and the investigation of epidemics.Science credit
prerequisites: Any B-level course in Anthropology or Biology and any statistics course.
